results.title: Interview with Christopher Doyle
results.brief_description:
Australian cinematographer Christopher Doyle talks about how time operates in his filmmaking, how life experience has shaped his work, the role of repetition, structure and movement in cinematogrpahy, how space informs and influences his technique, and about the collaborative process of filmmaking.
Includes clips from ‘Paranoid Park’ 2007; ‘Days of Being Wild’ (A Fei zheng chuan), 1990; ‘Happy Together’ (Chun gwong cha sit), 1997; ‘In the Mood for Love’ (Fa yeung nin wa), 2000; and ‘Fallen Angels’ (Duo luo tian shi), 1995.
results.description:

results.title: Screen worlds : Interview with Ab Rogers
results.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, Dean Lawry and Csilla Csongvay
results.brief_description: British designer Ab Rogers is founder and head of a multi-disciplinary studio in London ARD (Ab Rogers Desgin). Ab visited ACMI in December 2008 and the Content Development crew interviewed him in relation to his design and intent behind the Screen Worlds exhibition. He spoke about the tendering process, the challenges of designing for the Federation Square space, his overall approach to design and a brief introduction to the three sections, Emergence, Voices and Sensation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kim Montgomery, Dean Lawry and Csilla Csongvay

results.title: Our city cares
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Dean Lawry, Csilla Csongvay and Kim Montgomery
results.brief_description: As a gesture of support and in sympathy for those affected by Black Saturday the Melbourne community came together at Federation Square on Friday 27 February 2009 to show that the city cares. Visitors left an outline drawing of their hands on paper and wrote words of encouragement and pledges of support as part of the “Healing Hands” initiative.

results.title: Crash Zone: It's Only Words
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Anthony Morris
results.brief_description:
A computer virus invades Catalyst and it’s a fight against the clock to save Alex’s game ‘Trillin’ and indeed, the whole of Catalyst. The kids are not at their best as there’s friction between Mike and Bec. Bec believes he should have stood up for her when his friends made racist comments to her. No matter how much Mike apologises, the team is edgy.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: The Outsider
results.creator_credit: Stephen Johnson, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Philip Dalkin
results.brief_description:
When Virgil goes missing after confiding in Ram, it’s obvious to the kids that Sunijim has somehow ‘captured’ him. Marcello sees this as a way to redeem himself in Alex’s eyes and, with his friends’ help, infiltrates Sunijim in an attempt to rescue Virgil from Brad Kane. When Marcello gets into difficulties, the team use all their computer skills to save Marcello and Virgil, reuniting the Crash Zone team.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: The Shadow
results.creator_credit: Pino Amenta, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Anthony Morris
results.brief_description:
Marcello throws Catalyst into uproar when he hacks into Alex’s system. Alex brings in legendary hacker-tracker J.D. Moon to find the security breach. Marcello is too scared to own up to his foolishness and as J.D. Moon gets closer to the truth, the kids have to choose whether to help Marcello or not. When Alex discovers the truth, she fires Marcello.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Birthday
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Kevin Nemeth
results.brief_description:
Marcello’s unemployed father is acting strangely and Marcello believes he’s cracking up. While Bec has created her own game about gnomes, Marcello becomes convinced his father is going to kill himself. The kids, confused by Pi’s depression, Bec’s game and Marcello’s weirdness, are unsure exactly who is really cracking up.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.
